business.headline: India-US trade deal: Is Trump's 'big deal' claim a pressure tactic? Experts weigh inUS President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a trade deal with China on rare earths and hinted at a 'very big' trade agreement with India.

Wall Street rallies to record highs as AI stocks soar, recession fears easeUS stock markets hit all-time highs on Friday thanks to an AI boom and Fed hints at looser policy ahead. Trade deals with the UK and China have also fuelled market hopes that a global recession could be avoided.

HDFC Bank slashes FD and savings rates again in June. Details hereHDFC Bank's latest changes signal that deposit rates could remain soft if the RBI continues its rate-cutting cycle. Depositors should review their plans, stay updated with rate changes, and make informed decisions before booking new FDs or RDs.

EPFO may soon allow direct EPF withdrawals via ATMs and UPIThe EPFO recently increased the auto-settlement limit from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 5 lakh. This means members can get up to Rs 5 lakh cleared automatically within three days for things like medical expenses, education, housing, or marriage.
Sensex ends 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,600; Jio Financial shares jump 4%The S&P BSE Sensex ended 303.03 points higher at 84,058.90, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 88.80 to settle at 25,637.80.

Switched jobs this year? Here's how to file your ITR rightIf you worked for more than one employer in the same year, make sure to report each salary and related deductions separately in the ITR form. Don't mix them up; each employer's income should be shown in its own section. This helps avoid overlaps and mistakes.

Where are India's ultra-rich families investing in 2025?A new EY–Julius Baer report, The Indian Family Office Playbook, reveals that many family offices are moving away from traditional wealth preservation and diving into global markets, private credit, and real assets.

Rs 45 lakh for raising a child? Why parenting feels like a luxury nowRising everyday expenses, pricey education and costly healthcare are forcing many young couples to think twice about kids. According to a startup founder, starting a family is personal, but money has become a key factor.

Madras High Court backs bank appointment cancellation over adverse CIBIL reportThe Madras High Court upheld SBI's decision to cancel a candidate's appointment due to adverse credit history, stressing that financial discipline is essential for roles involving public money.

No guarantees in mutual funds: Investment adviser warns against risky PF adviceAn investment adviser explains why PF money should not be used for risky bets like mutual funds with "guaranteed returns."

Why saving 30% of your income isn't always possible, CA explainsFor those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, explains CA Abhishek Walia. For those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, he says.

Will Sensex and Nifty hit record highs in July? Here's all you need to knowWith domestic flows steady and global risks fading, July could be the moment markets break through resistance. But with key events ahead, will momentum hold or falter?

JSW Paints to acquire majority stake in Akzo Nobel IndiaWith this move, JSW Paints will take sole control of Akzo Nobel India, which operates under the Dulux brand, and emerge as the fourth-largest player in the decorative paints segment.

Sensex, Nifty open higher for 4th straight session as global cues aid momentumThe BSE Sensex opened with a gain of over 140 points and was trading 89.06 points higher at 83,844.93 around 9:22 am. The NSE Nifty50 breached the 25,600-mark at the open before paring some gains to trade 25.35 points up at 25,574.35.

Once-dominant online job boards CareerBuilder, Monster go bankruptCreated through the September merger of CareerBuilder and Monster, the Chicago-based company said it agreed to sell its job board operations, its most recognisable business, to JobGet, which has an app for so-called gig workers.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Penalties, missed refunds and what to do nextWhether you're a salaried professional, freelancer, or a business owner, choosing the right ITR (Income Tax Return) form is important. Getting it wrong might mean missed refunds, penalties, or worse, your return being treated as invalid.

Sensex ends 1,000 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,000.36 points to end at 83,755.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 304.25 points to close at 25,549.00.

From phones to partners: 8 money lessons to learn before 30Managing money isn't just about making budgets, it's about making better choices, every single day. CA Nitin Kaushik shares eight crucial money lessons that everyone should grasp by the age of 30.

Are your savings at risk? Government may slash PPF, NSC rates next weekSo far this year, interest rates for schemes such as Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), Senior Citizens Savings Scheme (SCSS), and Post Office term deposits have remained unchanged. However, this may not continue in the next quarter.

Housing sales drop 20% across top 7 cities in Q2 2025 as prices stay highA sluggish Q2 masked early signs of recovery in India's housing market, with rising prices, cautious buyers, and skewed supply dampening sales—but softening rates and easing tensions may turn the tide.

Hiding income or making wrong claims? Your ITR could attract a 200% penaltyThe recent changes in Income Tax Return (ITR) regulations highlight stricter penalties for incorrect filings, including a potential 200% penalty on false claims.

Roti, kapda, but no makaan? The disappearing dream of affordable housingAffordable housing is vanishing from India's cities, and the crisis runs deeper than shrinking supply. In this deep dive, we explore how rising costs, fading supply, and policy gaps are shutting the door on millions chasing the ownership dream.

How expensive a house should you buy? Investment banker shares these 6 rulesAn investment banker lays down six clear, conservative rules for home buying to help first-time buyers avoid the trap of overleveraged homeownership.

Received Form 16? Don't file your ITR without checking these pointsForm 16 is a certificate your employer gives you every year. It shows how much salary you earned in the financial year and how much tax was deducted from it. This tax is called TDS (Tax Deducted at Source).

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft as world's most valuable company after 4% surgeNvidia's shares touched a new record high of $154.10, after climbing 4.33% during the trading session. This rally followed a positive report from Loop Capital, which raised its price target for Nvidia from $175 to $250.

Sensex rises over 500 points, crosses 83,000: Why is stock market rising today?By 9:59 am, the Sensex had gained 549 points to touch 83,305.06, while the Nifty rose by 172.75 points to 25,417.50. The mood across the broader market was upbeat, and volatility remained surprisingly muted.

US Bitcoin Reserve signals a shift: An opening for IndiaIndia stands at a pivotal juncture. A measured Bitcoin strategy—perhaps a reserve pilot—could strengthen economic resilience and project modernity. As the US advances and nations like Bhutan adapt, India has a unique opportunity to lead.
Sensex opens 127 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; Eternal gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 364.24 points to 83,119.75, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.95 points to 25,359.70 as of 9:31 am.

Sebi penalises BSE Rs 25 lakh for unequal data access, failure in oversightSebi called the failure by BSE 'laxity and negligence' and pointed out that BSE, being a first-level regulator, has a duty to maintain a clean and fair trading environment.

Sensex, Nifty opening on June 26: Will stock market rise again today?As of 8:24 am, the Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,287 points. This suggests that the Nifty50 could open around its previous close of 25,244.75.

Stocks to watch on June 26: SBI, Tata Steel, One Mobikwik, Adani EnterprisesStrong global signals and a steady flow of news from domestic companies helped keep investor sentiment upbeat as Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session.
Adani Total Gas and Jio-bp partner to expand fuel access across IndiaThis collaboration will see Jio-bp's premium petrol and diesel sold at select Adani fuel outlets, according to ATGL's statement.
Sensex closes 700 points higher, Nifty above 25,200, Titan up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 700.40 points to end at 82,755.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 200.40 points to close at 25,244.75.

Jewellery vs gold ETFs: How to make make money shine, not just wrists, explains CAGold jewellery may look beautiful, but it often comes with hidden costs, resale hassles, and emotional attachment that cloud financial judgement.

Planning to buy a house? This is India's most affordable city in 2025A report from Knight Frank India's latest Affordability Index highlights that RBI's decision to cut the repo rate by 100 basis points since February 2025 has played a key role in improving housing affordability across the country.

Want SIP success? Do this every month, says stock market expertSIP calculators do a fine job of showing projections. However, they don't account for emotions, self-doubt, or the unpredictability of life, mentioned a stock market expert.
GST Council meeting: What to expect from upcoming meet?The previous GST Council meeting took place on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Since then, many matters have remained pending.

8 key documents you must keep ready before filing your ITR for FY 2024–25One of the first documents you'll need is Form 16, which your employer gives you. It shows your total salary, how much tax was deducted, and what deductions were claimed.

EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 722.55 points to 82,777.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 209.15 points to 25,253.50 as of 2:25 pm.

entertainment.headline: Saif Ali Khan enjoys a day out at the park with sons Ibrahim, Taimur, and JehIbrahim Ali Khan shared heartwarming photos from a fun day out at the park with his father Saif Ali Khan and younger brothers Taimur and Jeh. The pataudi brothers were seen enjoying nature and playing cricket in the park.

We made plans just a week back: Arti Singh mourns Shefali Jariwala's sudden deathActor Arti Singh expressed deep sorrow over the sudden death of her friend and Bigg Boss 13 co-contestant Shefali Jariwala. The actor also extended condolences to Shefali's family,

Suriya-Jyotika enjoy vacation in Seychelles, fans call them made for each otherSuriya and Jyotika are enjoying a vacation in Seychelles, with Jyotika posting a video of their fun moments by the beach. Fans admired their chemistry and said the holiday scenes brought back nostalgic vibes.

Shefali Jariwala was planning her next 20 years: Kaanta Laga directorVinay Sapru opens up about the sudden death of Shefali Jariwala, the face of 'Kaanta Laga'. He reflects on her dedication, warmth, and the lasting impact she made on Indian pop culture.

Priyanka Chopra enjoys borderless brunching with Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, Mira NairPriyanka Chopra received heartfelt support from her family in India, who hosted a special screening of her upcoming film 'Heads Of State'. The actor also spent her weekend with filmmakers Sharmeen Obaid Chinoy and Mira Nair, calling it a fun day.

Raja Chaudhary claims Abhinav Kohli came crying after separation from Shweta TiwariActor Raja Chaudhary has claimed that Shweta Tiwari's second husband, Abhinav Kohli, came to him in tears after their marriage ended. He also alleged that Shweta initially introduced Abhinav as a 'brother' before marrying him.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 9: Aamir's film outshines new releasesAamir Khan's sports drama 'Sitaare Zameen Par' collected Rs 108.30 crore in nine days. The film earned more than the new releases - 'Maa', 'Kannappa' and 'F1'.

Maa box office Day 2: Kajol film crosses Rs 10 crore after solid Saturday growthKajol's mythological horror film 'Maa' sees a significant box office jump on day two. The film's unique blend of mythology and horror is winning audience appreciation despite mixed reviews.

Kannappa box office Day 2: Vishnu Manchu's film crosses Rs 15 croreVishnu Manchu's film 'Kannappa' has crossed Rs 15 crore at the box office on its second day despite a minor dip, maintaining steady footfall across regions. The mythological action-drama is performing well, especially in Telugu-speaking areas, outshining other big releases of the week.

Paras Chhabra slams paparazzi for insensitive coverage after Shefali Jariwala's deathParas Chhabra strongly criticised the paparazzi for insensitive reporting, especially regarding a news piece about Parag Tyagi taking Shefali Jariwala's pet dog for a walk soon after her death.

Raja Chaudhary reacts to Palak Tiwari's dating rumoursActor Raja Chaudhary addressed his distant relationship with daughter Palak Tiwari and expressed concern over her alleged romance with Ibrahim Ali Khan. He advised Palak to prioritise her career over relationships at this stage.

Pray for my Pari: Shefali Jariwala's husband Parag Tyagi's emotional appealFollowing the final rites, Shefali Jariwala's husband, Parag Tyagi, appeared visibly distraught. Addressing the paparazzi with folded hands, he urged everyone to pray for his "Pari." Holding back emotion, he said, "Please pray for her - that wherever she is, she's happy and at peace."

Javed Akhtar backs Diljit Dosanjh amid Sardaar Ji 3 row: What can the poor guy doJaved Akhtar defended Diljit Dosanjh amid backlash over 'Sardaar Ji 3', which features Pakistani actor Hania Aamir. He noted the film was shot before recent tensions and urged sensitivity, while advising against such casting in the future.

Shreyas Talpade, Sunidhi Chauhan, Rashami Desai pay tribute to late ShefaliActor Shefali Jariwala died at the age of 42 at her Mumbai home on Friday night. Celebrities including Shreyas Talpade, Sunidhi Chauhan, Rashami Desai, among others, paid their tributes to her at her home.
Shefali Jariwala cremated in Mumbai, husband Parag Tyagi bids emotional goodbyeActor-model Shefali Jariwala was cremated at the Oshiwara Crematorium on Saturday. She died of cardiac arrest at 42.

Shefali Jariwala dies at 42: Old clip hinting at actor's sudden death resurfacesActor Shefali Jariwala died of cardiac arrest at 42, leaving fans and the industry in shock. An old video of her discussing epilepsy and astrological reading about her "sudden death" has resurfaced, which has gone viral.

Absolutely shattered: Shefali Jariwala's ex-husband Harmeet Singh mourns her deathMeet Bros' Harmeet Singh, who is also Shefali Jariwala's ex-husband, mourned her untimely death. Sharing an emotional tribute on social media, the singer reflected on the time they had spent together and extended his heartfelt condolences to her family.

Amitabh Bachchan praises son Abhishek as he completes 25 years in film industryAmitabh Bachchan celebrated son Abhishek Bachchan's 25 years in Bollywood with a heartfelt post on social media, calling him "worthy of praise." The tribute followed a fan-made video showcasing Abhishek's memorable roles and journey in the industry.

Sunidhi Chauhan, Rashami Desai and celebs pay tribute to Shefali JariwalaActor Shefali Jariwala died at the age of 42 on Friday, June 27. Her funeral will take place today at the Oshiwara Crematorium. After the postmortem, the actor's body was brought to her home, where friends and industry colleagues are arriving to bid her a final goodbye.

general news.headline: Puri stampede: 2 officials transferred after 3 killed, 50 injured during Rath YatraPuri stampede: The incident took place near Saradhabali, in front of the temple, where Lord Jagannath was seated on the chariot.

She broke a family: Kalyan Banerjee says Mahua Moitra is 'most anti-woman'Kalyan Banerjee's attack comes in response to Mahua Moitra slamming her party, Trinamool Congress, for not condemning its own leaders over loose talk, taking an indirect dig at his 'avoid bad company' remark in the Kolkata law college gang rape case.
Monsoon arrives early in India as Delhi sees light rains, floods in UttarakhandScattered rain and thunderstorm warnings kept Delhi-NCR on alert as the monsoon tightened its grip on North India.

Indian woman, 24, vanishes in US days after arriving for arranged marriageAfter launching a probe and reviewing nearby CCTV footage, local police found that the woman, identified as Simran, was seen checking her phone and looking around - apparently waiting for someone before she went missing on Wednesday. The authorities further noted that Simran didn't appear to be in any distress from what they could make out from the footage.

Will Mumbai's dance bar girls get to emerge from the shadows?In Mumbai, dance bars, which have been banned since 2005, now operate as orchestra bars. Nothing much has changed, other than the bar girls, mostly young women, being deprived of their income. Experts, associations and bar girls say legalising the dance bars will transform their lives.

Asim Munir at it again; threatens India, calls Pak net regional stabiliserBlaming India for escalating regional tensions, Munir vowed a decisive response to any future Indian aggression. Speaking at the Pakistan Naval Academy in Karachi on Saturday, Munir called Pakistan a 'net regional stabiliser,' claiming that Islamabad had responded 'resolutely' to 'unprovoked' Indian military aggression.

Pak blames India for Waziristan suicide attack, Centre responds: Deserves contemptNew Delhi dismissed Islamabad's allegations linking India to a deadly suicide bombing in North Waziristan that killed 13 soldiers. The attack was claimed by the Hafiz Gul Bahadur group, as militant violence escalates in Pakistan's border areas.

BJP-RSS deadlock over new party chief drags on, state leadership in limboThe BJP and RSS remain deadlocked over choosing a new national president, with the decision now likely hinging on key discussions at the upcoming RSS meet in Delhi.

Wimbledon 2025 preview: Who are the favourites and what's new this year?Wimbledon 2025 Preview: The prestigious grass-court Grand Slam runs from June 30 to July 13. Carlos Alcaraz enters the tournament fresh off his French Open triumph, aiming for a third consecutive Wimbledon title. On the women's side, the singles field remains wide open, continuing the recent trend of unpredictability.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Russia fires 537 aerial weapons at Ukraine in biggest attack since start of warRussia fired a total of 537 aerial weapons at Ukraine, including 477 drones and decoys and 60 missiles, Ukraine's air force said. Of these, 249 were shot down and 226 were lost.

Kolkata law college CCTV shows student being dragged, confirms allegations: CopsThe footage, which also captured moments leading up to the June 25 incident, shows the first-year law student being forced into the guard's room.

Employee's 'Main to jaa rahi hoon' mail stuns CEO, delights the InternetA light-hearted leave email with the subject line "Main to jaa rahi hoon" left a CEO confused and the internet grinning at its hilarious tone.

90,000 students failed in Karnataka due to language imposition, says DMK ministerTamil Nadu Minister Anbil Mahesh claimed 90,000 students in Karnataka failed due to language imposition. He also slammed the Centre for withholding education funds from states like Tamil Nadu and Kerala.

Police alone can't stop rapes: Shocker from Madhya Pradesh top copWhen asked about the cause behind the rising cases of rape, the Madhya Pradesh top cop, Kailash Makwana, claimed that people have easy access to obscene material due to the widespread availability of cell phones and the internet.
21-year-old Hindu woman raped by local politician in Bangladesh, five arrestedThe woman had come to visit her father's home from her husband's house 15 days prior to the incident.

From Palakkad's paddy fields to Dakar Glory: Harith Noah's arc continues its voyageBeing forged on the paddy fields in Shoranur, Palakkad, Harith Noah established himself as an Indian motorsport legend with his exploits at the Dakar Rally. Speaking exclusively to India Today, the 32-year-old opens up on his beginning, the connection with Dakar and the future of the sport in India.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!
2 dead, 7 missing after cloudburst hits Uttarakhand, Char Dham Yatra suspendedNine workers had gone missing after the incident and rescue efforts are ongoing to locate the remaining seven.

'Great victory': Trump's sweeping tax-cut, spending bill clears key US Senate testThe 51-49 procedural vote followed hours of gridlock, with Vice President JD Vance present at the Capitol to potentially cast a tie-breaking vote.
Man pretends to keep job after layoff, lands better role through 'fake' LinkedIn postIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a man shared how faking continued employment led him to a better job.

Hair transplants: Why practice matters more than just theoryAs hair transplants become more popular and accessible, the need for hands-on training grows stronger. Experts say that real-world experience—not just theory—is key to ensuring safe, natural-looking results in this delicate and demanding procedure.

BJP expels Uttarakhand ex-MLA over second marriage, Congress seeks actionThe BJP has expelled ex-MLA Suresh Rathore for six years over a second marriage controversy, prompting Congress to demand legal action under Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code.

Shefali Jariwala was planning her next 20 years: Kaanta Laga directorVinay Sapru opens up about the sudden death of Shefali Jariwala, the face of 'Kaanta Laga'. He reflects on her dedication, warmth, and the lasting impact she made on Indian pop culture.

sports.headline: Batter dies on pitch due to heart attack after hitting sixA batter suffered a heart attack after hitting a six during a cricket match in Firozpur, Punjab. The victim identified as Harjeet Singh died immediately.

Club World Cup: Chelsea take down Benfica, 10-man Palmeiras beat BotafogoThe first two round of 16 matches in the Club World Cup went to extra time, with Chelsea taking the win over Benfica while Palmeiras edged past the in-form Botafogo despite having one player sent off.

Wimbledon 2025 preview: Who are the favourites and what's new this year?Wimbledon 2025 Preview: The prestigious grass-court Grand Slam runs from June 30 to July 13. Carlos Alcaraz enters the tournament fresh off his French Open triumph, aiming for a third consecutive Wimbledon title. On the women's side, the singles field remains wide open, continuing the recent trend of unpredictability.

India pacer Khaleel Ahmed set to make county debut, signs deal with EssexIndia seamer Khaleel Ahmed is all set to make his debut in county cricket as he's signed a deal with Essex. Ahmed has scalped 56 wickets in first class cricket from 20 matches.

Let Shubman Gill captain for 3 years, even if we lose in England: Ravi ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri has urged the team management to retain Shubman Gill as the captain of the Test team for three years, irrespective of what happens in the ongoing series against England.

Really want to win the title: Carlos Alcaraz targets rare three-peatWimbledon 2025: 22-year-old Carlos Alcaraz is looking to become only the fourth man to complete a three-peat in the grass-court major after Bjorn Borg, Pete Sampras, Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic.

WI vs AUS: ICC punishes Darren Sammy for criticising umpire Adrian HoldstockWest Indies head coach Darren Sammy has been fined by the ICC (International Cricket Council) for openly criticising umpire Adrian Holdstock during the first Test against Australia in Barbados.

Watch: Paul Pogba breaks down in tears after AS Monaco move post-doping banPaul Pogba was left in tears after making his return to football after officially signing for AS Monaco following his 18-month ban for doping.

My responsibility to get better: Prasidh hopes to improve after 1st Test let-downPrasidh Krishna highlighted how he wanted to try something different against the England batters and their aggressive approach. Despite the poor returns, the speedster sounded confident of putting in a better performance at Edgbaston.

Couldn't feel my legs: Rohit Sharma recalls T20 World Cup final jittersRohit Sharma recalled how nervous he was before taking the field in the final of the Men's T20 World Cup last year. India won the title after beating South Africa at the Kensington Oval.

Wimbledon 2025 best chance to win 25th major: Novak DjokovicWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic said that the upcoming grass-court major could be the best chance for him to win his 25th Grand Slam title, and his first since the 2023 US Open.

WI vs AUS: ICC punishes Darren Sammy for criticising umpire Adrian HoldstockWest Indies head coach Darren Sammy has been fined by the ICC (International Cricket Council) for openly criticising umpire Adrian Holdstock during the first Test against Australia in Barbados.

Despite the poor returns, the speedster sounded confident of putting in a better performance at Edgbaston.

Couldn't feel my legs: Rohit Sharma recalls T20 World Cup final jittersRohit Sharma recalled how nervous he was before taking the field in the final of the Men's T20 World Cup last year. India won the title after beating South Africa at the Kensington Oval.

Wimbledon 2025 best chance to win 25th major: Novak DjokovicWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic said that the upcoming grass-court major could be the best chance for him to win his 25th Grand Slam title, and his first since the 2023 US Open.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
